body.p: Most WaveStar Infinity connections are made in manufacturing, but some must be made at the customer site during installation. Customer connections and setup methodology are summarized in .

Typical on-site WaveStar Infinity installation activities are listed below. Detailed information on making the following connections and performing setup are in WaveStar Infinity Monitoring System, Setup and Operation P-164001106.
Customer Ethernet and Modbus RTU connections are made directly to the WaveStar Infinity Monitor backpanel.
Most sensor board connections are made at the factory, but some must be made when the PDU is installed. These connections are typically the following:
Remote EPO connection to the Sensor Base VVIT Board
Digital inputs, such as building alarms, to a Digital Inputs Option Board
Output relays, such as a summary alarm, to a Relay Option Board
Subfeed CTs are wired to 8xI Sensor Board(s) in manufacturing, but they must be installed over load cables when the load cables are connected to subfeed circuit breakers. See section .
After making local connections, an administrator must configure WaveStar Infinity for the local network, set up user administration, and specify alarm limits and other parameters. All setup can be performed at the local WaveStar Infinity Monitor or, once the network is configured, from a browser. WaveStar Infinity Customer Connections
